product.title: Toy Story 3 | Disney Book Club by Early Moments
product.ingress:
Things are changing for Woody, Buzz, and the rest of the beloved toys in Andy’s room—because Andy is leaving for college. In this retelling of the heartwarming original Disney·Pixar movie Toy Story 3, readers find out what happens to toys once their kid has grown up and no longer plays with them. Put in a bag meant for the attic—but accidentally set out with the trash—the toys find themselves donated to a day care center. There, the toys encounter a pink bear named Lotso and struggle with the question of whether being played with and staying together is more important than being with Andy. This touching story about letting go and moving on reminds readers of the power of loyalty and friendship—and how standing by your friends saves the day in the end.

Tie-in Activity: Many children have a hard time letting go of toys—even ones they have long since outgrown. If you’re ready to do some cleaning, consider allowing your child to help you sort through her old toys after reading the story. Talk about someone who could play with the toys now, or where they could be donated. Consider letting your child be the “big” kid and actually give his toys to a younger child.
